policy_source: Local Coverage Determination (LCD) L36007, Lower Extremity Major Joint Replacement (Hip and Knee)

checklist_sections.title: Medical Necessity
checklist_sections.description: The procedure must be medically reasonable and necessary for the patient's condition.

items.label: Advanced Joint Disease
items.help_text: Check if the patient has advanced joint disease demonstrated by radiographic supported evidence or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

items.label: History of Unsuccessful Conservative Therapy
items.help_text: Check if the patient has a history of unsuccessful conservative therapy that is clearly documented in the pre-procedure medical record.

items.label: Pain with Functional Disability
items.help_text: Check if the patient has pain with functional disability due to arthritis or trauma to the knee joint.

items.label: Distinct Structural Abnormalities
items.help_text: Check if the patient has distinct structural abnormalities such as distal femur fracture, proximal tibia fracture, malignancy of the distal femur, proximal tibia, knee joint or adjacent soft tissues.

items.label: Failed Previous Joint Replacement
items.help_text: Check if the patient has a failed previous joint replacement necessitating revision as indicated by loosening, fracture, or mechanical failure of one or more components.

checklist_sections.title: Provider Qualifications
checklist_sections.description: The provider must be appropriately trained and qualified to perform the procedure.

items.label: Accredited Residency or Fellowship
items.help_text: Check if the provider has completed an accredited residency or fellowship program in the applicable specialty/subspecialty.

items.label: Continued Medical Education
items.help_text: Check if the provider has completed continued medical education activities that are comprehensive and designated by the American Medical Association (AMA) as Category 1 Credit.

checklist_sections.title: Documentation Requirements
checklist_sections.description: The medical record must contain sufficient documentation to support the medical necessity of the procedure.

items.label: Medical Record Documentation
items.help_text: Check if the medical record contains documentation that supports the medical necessity of the services as directed in this policy.

items.label: Signature Requirements
items.help_text: Check if the medical record contains the legible signature of the physician or non-physician practitioner responsible for and providing the care to the patient.

exception_pathways.title: Exceptional Circumstances
exception_pathways.description: The patient has exceptional circumstances that warrant an exception to the standard requirements.

items.label: Description of Exceptional Circumstances
items.help_text: Provide a description of the exceptional circumstances that warrant an exception to the standard requirements.

exclusions.title: Active Infection
exclusions.description: The patient has an active infection that contraindicates the procedure.

exclusions.title: Progressive Neurological Disease
exclusions.description: The patient has a progressive neurological disease that contraindicates the procedure.

denial_prevention_tips: Ensure that the medical record contains sufficient documentation to support the medical necessity of the procedure.
Verify that the provider has completed an accredited residency or fellowship program in the applicable specialty/subspecialty.
Check that the medical record contains the legible signature of the physician or non-physician practitioner responsible for and providing the care to the patient.
submission_reminders: Ensure that all required documentation is submitted with the claim.
Verify that the claim is submitted within the required timeframe.
Check that the claim is complete and accurate before submission.
